column4: I enjoyed this stop on our White Pass drive. We got to see sled dog puppies and a few other animals, including horses, donkeys, and alpaca. We had the opportunity to take a sled dog ride but didn't. There was a nice gift shop here as well.

We took a bus tour up to the Yukon as an excursion from a cruise and man it was awesome. We had lunch at Caribou Crossing which was very nice, but not as nice as the staff. They have sled dogs, horses, goats, plenty of souvenirs and local honey, candy, and goodies. You can learn about the history of the...

Great set up!!!! Great time!!!! Wish i had more time to stay!!! Loved the puppies!!!! Sled dog rides!!! And the museum was very interesting!!!! Food was okay. But all in all, i highly recommend that, if you are in the area, stop in!!!! You will not regret it!!! Trust me!!!

While on our Alaskian cruise, we booked an 8 hour excursion to visit the Yukon, followed by the Yukon White Pass railway back to Skagway, this was the highlight of our 18 day holiday.We were bussed from the ship at Skagway, our driver was called Bruce, and we couldn't have got a better tour guide, he was first class....
Lunch was great, people were friendly, souvenir shop had a lot of variety...museum was awesome, amount of time spent there was perfect. we would love to return there again, in the near future.
This is a awesome place to visit so many things to do in Carcross and something fo revery season great BERRY picking too close by happy trails :)
What a lovely place! Great food, wonderful people! Loved the animals! This is a must stop on your trip!

A really good stop off for lunch on our coach and train tour to the Yukon. From the welcome as we entered the premises to a good hearty baked potato and chicken meal. The donuts were to die for too. The animal park had the natural Alaskan feel to it and again everyone made us feel so at home. Thank...

Part of a tour with a cruise, so very limited time there. Wish I had more time there. Food was so good!! Dog sled ride was awesome and I recommend doing it! I loved seeing all the animals and getting to feed them.
it was a wonderful bbq chicken lunch followed by an ice cream cone at the local store - a browse through the gift shop and off to the petting zoo and dog sleds - a fun day

I enjoyed shopping at Caribou Crossing during my Alaska cruise! The people in the shop were very friendly and eager to help. The selection of items for sale was varied and well priced within my price range.
A little different to the stuff in Skagway, still as touristy, but a lot of fun to look around. Nice staff, full of good local info, and a good ice cream shop. mmmmm

Our first stop was lunch in the Trading Post Hut. Excellent, tasty lunch with endless donuts and coffee for dessert. The Wildlife museum is a must, such an interesting place for all age groups. The gift shop has a huge variety of gifts at reasonable prices. The husky dogs on view was wonderful to see and the hands on experience...
Friendly staff, beautiful scenery and great food. You can't go wrong visiting Caribou Crossing. Great attractions as well.
Staff very friendly, interesting great little store with interesting gifts. The taxidermy museum was unbelievable. Would recommend this place for everyone.

We left by motor coach from Skagway and had lunch at this site. Beautiful exhibits a delightful museum and lunch was served in a atmosphere of the Chuck Wagon days. We were able to feed the retired sled dogs and see the young puppies. They have built a replica of an early frontier village complete with covered wagons .
Well worth a visit, a step back in time . We had a great bus driver Lila , who really made the trip extra special.Make lots of time to fully explore the store and town .

We had a great BBQ chicken lunch and an even better fall dog sled ride. It is amazing how fired up the dogs get when they know they are going on a run. Great place, run by a wonderful outfit. I would return.

We boarded a bus from Alaska Skagway (holland america) to Yukon as a day's trip and in time to come back before our ship departs. We ended our Yukon trip at this place before heading back to our cruise ship.Many animals here, including wolfs, lamas, dogs etcThere are also dog sledding activities.Also surprised to find that the...

I was not really sure what to expect, however our group of 4 ended up being pleasantly surprised!There is SO much to do here. Lunch, mining displays, petting zoo, animal museum and dog camp!We had very limited time here with the particular tour we were on. I wish it had been longer so that we could've seen more....

One option I had on my cruise package was to take a train from Skagway which I did. It was a great trip through rugged country going from the forest to tundra, passing the trail of '96 that was used during the Gold Rush days and into Canada. We boarded a bus and for a city gal seemed to travel...

I drove along the Klondike Highway for fun hoping to find some bears on my Yukon visit from Ontario. Instead, I came across Carcross Trading Post and I was intrigued by the history displays and taxidermy animal exhibit, which displayed DOZENS of northern animals. Most delightful of all was the Alaskan Husky puppies I met. There were 8 beautiful puppies...

Part of a cruise package. We stopped for lunch and had bbq chicken, coleslaw, rolls and donuts. Very tasty. The set up is rustic with lots of real sled dogs, puppies and assorted other animals. Nice stop on the road.

We visit here at least once a year and spend the day.We love seeing the different types of animals in the museum and our favorite is definitely interacting with the animals outside! Puppy cuddles,dog belly rubs, cute goats eager for a treat and scratch on there heads, cute little miniature houses, a beautiful station, adorable donkeys,chickens, even a pair...

A typical tourist trap - gift shop - small museum with a few animals on display - horses and several other animals to pet - dog sleds. But, do not be tricked into believing the mountain goats up on the side of the mountain are for real. They are not.

We loved the stop at Caribou Crossing during our Skagway excursion on our recent Alaskan cruise. Our only disappointment is that we didn't have more time to enjoy everything they had to offer. Lunch was delicious and offered a vegetarian option as an alternative to bbq chicken. Some really tasty local beers were available for purchase and if you're in...

We took an excursion from our cruise stop in Skagway.It was a beautiful drive from Skagway with very interesting, varied scenery.We were here for about 1 1/2 hours.There is a world class museum full of taxidermy. There are animals native to the area as wellas Smithsonian quality displays of other wildlife.There was a dog sled...
Great family adventure . Lots to do great food we had so much fun thanks everyone beautiful peaceful place

Wonderful place to visit and have a great lunch followed by delicious ice cream for dessert. We really enjoyed the museum as well as the live animals and the opportunity to take a dog sled ride. Must take time to stop by if in the area.
Trading Post is the largest store in this little town. It has lots of tourist items and little food shop.

My husband and I took The Whitepass and Yukon Route excursion and stopped in Carcross for about an hour and a half. The only thing I could complain about is that the stop in at the Caribou Crossing Trading Post was way too short. We spent time with the animals but didn't have enough time to go through the gift...

This visit was part of an excursion while on a cruise to Alaska. We are Canadians from Ontario so it was a big thrill to come here. The BBQ lunch was very good, wildlife centre awesome and seeing the sled dogs who were so cute. I would definitely recommend this place.
My family and I flew across Canada from Nova Scotia and were met with a Great staff ,very clean, interesting exhibits just great all around thanx
Terrific spot on our coach tour very friendly people the food was 2 die for we all (26) had a fun time.

Our bus tour stopped here for lunch. The bbq chicken was well prepared and quite delicious. Watching the sled dogs run was truly amazing. The museums, though quite small, were well done. We couldn't pass up the opportunity to visit and cuddle with the sled dog pups. On the way out, snag a cup of tiger tail ice cream (orange...

This was the lunch stop on our White Pass Expedition & Railway shore excursion from the Crown Princess. We expected a tourist trap. Glad to say we were wrong. Barbecue chicken lunch can be enjoyed in the dining hall or replica chuck wagons. Local beer is available, a big plus for us. There's a RCMP & wildlife museum that are...

We paid about $60 per person for the 30 minute dog sled ride. When we got there, we took the dog sled ride for one circle around the grounds and were off in less than ten mins. Then, they bored us with a ridiculous presentation! The website does not mention anything about a presentation! We paid for a 30 minute...
This store is filled with all sorts of things upon which to spend your money - the lady working in there is very friendly too.

The spirit of the Klondike gold rush is still thriving at the Caribou Crossing Trading Post, where it’s not only still possible to pan for gold but also actually find some.Gold panning is just the start of the fun at Caribou Crossing, as it is home to a pack of barking Iditarod Dogsled Race veteran huskies, each teeming to...

This was part of a shore excursion offered by Princess Cruises. We had a warm and sunny day to visit which we heard was not typical. The food was good but the donuts were a bit greasy. It was served with a smile and very quickly. The animals, especially the sled dogs and puppies, were a highlight and we learned...

On our way from Whitehorse to Skagway, we stopped at Caribou Crossing Trading Post just before we got to Carcross. We heard all the sled dogs barking as soon as we pulled up. There was also a really cool looking cabin right near the parking lot. For $9, we went through the NWMP Museum, then a taxidermy exhibit with a...

This was a stop on our Yukon rail/coach excursion out of Skagway. Our tour included the barbecue chicken lunch, which was served by the local community. The portions were generous and the food very good. The staff handled the busloads of tourists in a very timely fashion but still had warm smiles and appeared welcoming and unhurried. The restroom facilities...

We booked an excursion that started inside the Yukon Heath Popcorn Emporium. Our grandsons were excited to show off their passports. Our tour guide, Bryan Terrell, was terrific! A terrific storyteller, he made certain we noticed all the sites: the "bouncy bridge" built to survive earthquakes, the fresh water system for Skagway, the train in the valley, the carcross desert,...

This was our lunch stop on our Yukon expedition with Disney. They offer many fun things to do such as panning for gold (seemed everyone find a bit!), dog sled rides, a visit with Alaskan husky puppies, many gift shops and a museum with interesting displays and animals including a woolly mammoth.All in all we had a great time...

We stopped at the Caribou Crossing Trading Post as part of an 8 hour cruise line excursion. This stop lasted about 1.5 hours and included b-b-q chicken lunch.To my wife and son the best part of the day here was being able to get in the pen with the dog sled puppies. I enjoyed the b-b-q chicken and really...

Totally enjoyed all the fun and relaxing experience at Cariboo Crossing - loved the atmosphere, loved the animals and the people were very pleasant. Totally enjoyed the Dog Sled ride - was a thrill and loved the way the animals were looked after. Very professional and nice to experience. The wildlife museum was one of the best we had seen....
It costs $35 a head for about 10 minutes of dog sledding on a cart. I loved it and was able to cuddle the puppies. The museum was awesome too.

I found the "animal museum" of the stuffed carcasses of beautiful wildlife quite disturbing. In another city we enjoyed mushing in the snow on a glacier, but these dogs pulling wheeled carts in hotter temperatures and on short chains was not a pleasurable sight.Caribou Crossing served a lovely lunch and I was pleasantly surprised at the vegetarian option provided....

We stopped here while on a Yukon Tour with Southeast Tours. Lunch was delicious- bbq chicken, coleslaw, rolls, and a donut for dessert- all homemade. They also sell beer, local root beer, and ciders! After lunch we toured the small history museum and natural history museum before petting the dogs at the dog mushing camp. It was a great stop...

Stopped here on a tour for lunch. The BBQ chicken was excellent. Very neat museum with numerous stuffed/mounted animals. Petted the dog sled dogs and had a nice ice cream cone. Did not try the dog sledding. Caution if on a cruise from Skagway... There is a one hour time change. We watched numerous people who rented cars show up...

As must stop if you are in the Yukon. A cool museum, dog sled training that will actually take you on a ride, gift shop, petting zoo, and an awesome bbq chicken lunch! The staff are very friendly and welcoming!

First of all, Caribou Crossing is awesome. We had some much fun over there.Our cruise ship anchored in Skagway, we rented a car, and drove about 2 hours to get to Caribou Crossing. It is a gorgeous drive and it is definitely worth it. You NEED your passports though so make sure that you bring that cause you will...
Thoroughly enjoyable day -great lunch which was provided with our tour - museum was terrific, so lifelike

Caribou Crossing was a welcomed lunch stop after a morning of train and bus rides. As noted above, there's not much excitement happening here, BUT if you just want to relax, and enjoy some good home cooking, this is the place for you. The staff was so well organized that getting through the lunch was a breeze. My husband and...

I came to Caribou Crossing through an excursion with Chilkoot Charters. The lunch of barbecue chicken, fresh rolls, and cinnamon donuts was top-notch, just what we needed to refuel after a long, beautiful morning on the train and bus touring the scenery. My excursion included access to the two small museums and petting zoo on site, and a 15-minute dogcart...
Scenery was beautiful, food was great, servers were interesting and the trip was wonderful. Lower this I dant do essays. Goats were goats, puppies were puppies.

This was the most informative and entertaining tour we did. We saw lots of wildlife. Brook was an outstanding guide. Very knowledgeable and entertaining. She was willing to turn the bus around to offer views of passing wildlife without hesitation. Would recommend to everyone who wants to see the Yukon territory. There is also no worry about being back to...

It is a lovely ride out to Carribou Crossing.Pass the worlds smallest desert and fabulous scenery.The trading post is great fun with museums and dog sledding tracks plus several interesting buildings and lunch in a coveted wagon or mess hall.The kids will love it....and so will you.
This was a great trip. The bus ride there was comfortable and the train ride back was beautiful. The food here was good, the animals were cute and the taxidermy building was amazing!

What a wonderful experience. This was a stop on our day long tour of Alaska, BC and the Yukon territory . My daughter and I totally enjoyed the food, the opportunity to meet and play with the sled dogs and other animals.The museum and gift shop both added to our adventure.

Good food, good Ice cream! Loved the taxidermy museum! SledDogs were adorable!! Worth the trip! Lots of sight seeing on the way from cruise port. Saw 2 bears and mountain goats, a porcupine, and many other wildlife

column3: Elk Grove Village, Illinois, United States
column4: Very friendly town and great middle spot for the road and rail tour of Yukon. According to one of our party there has been a significant addition of interesting shops and things to see. We were on an excursion from the Grand Princess ship.

This was where our excursion stopped for lunch just before we turned around to head back to Skagway. The food was awesome, the service staff was very friendly and those doughnuts were delightful. We really enjoyed all of the animals in the museum and my wife fell in love with the puppies. This excursion was one of the best things...

We just happened to be driving past Caribou Crossing when I saw a sign saying 'puppies.' We pulled in to see if we could see some cute husky puppies. What we got was so,so, so much better! The animals (goats, llama, horses, donkeys among others) were very excited to be fed. (Buy a bag of food near their pens). The...

Can only take 30 munites or you can spend half a day. Fantastic little museum. Everything was very well labelled. The RCMP exhibit was a highlight. Not to mention the huge animals. And the puppies. Stop here and do the museum!

Had a great day at Carcross, the trading post, town and emerald lake, at the trading post had a lovely bbq lunch and historic museum and gift shop, highlight of the day was seeing the husky puppies and cute cuddles xXx

We visited the museum in June as part of an Alaska off-shore excursion from Skagway. The museum had so many animals, bears, moose, wolves, elephants, bisons, almost any animals available in Alaska and they all looked like alive. It is the most extensive wildlife museum we have ever seen. The BBQ chicken lunch with coleslaw was very yummy too, well...
My husband and I had a great time. Staff was helpful, courteous and I would recommend this to everyone!
This was a very clean, adorable and educational place. We loved the lunch and especially the donuts! The puppies were soo cute and treated well!
We had a great time visiting. I wish we could have spent more time enjoying all that they had to offer. The food was awesome !

This was our lunch stop on our Skagway excursion while on our cruise on the Coral Princess. The BBQ lunch was delicious! The petting animals (including puppies) were wonderful. The taxidermy museum was amazing! I would spend time here again in a heart beat!
We enjoyed our time there, lunch was great. The thing I enjoyed most was the puppies! I got to hold one and it was adorable. The dogs were very neat to watch. The whole setting there is very nice.

We stopped here because lunch was included with our mini bus tour. The lunch was excellent as were the staff who worked in the cafe.We wouldn't have known about the Trading Post if it wasn't included in our tour. its well worth a visit, you could easily spend a few hours here having a meal and looking at the...

This is an outstanding "Natural History" museum, with a remarkable collection of stuffed animals, very well done. You will see displays including a full-size mammoth, and a number of other extinct creatures from the area. plus everything from bears to wolverines and smaller animals and birds. A real eye-opener, not just to what used to be roaming this territory, but...

You can't knock this place for being touristy. It's in the middle of nowhere! So pop in, have lunch, do some shopping, see the dogs, and have some fun! Was here on a shore excursion from a cruise ship. Treated to a nice lunch of BBQ chicken, baked potato, coleslaw, and fresh donuts. Nice! Staff are very friendly and there's...

Traveled to Caribou Crossing in June 2016 while in port in Skagway, AK. We rented a car and drove to the Yukon. We stopped here to see the different activities that were happening. For about $8 CAD, you can view the museum, husky puppies and animal petting area. For a $1 you can feed Spirit the horse and also a...

We stopped here as part of an excursion from Skagway. Had a very good chicken lunch, there was a bar with a reasonable selection of beers.Included in this was entrance to their animal museum which consisted of stuffed bears, moose, wolves etc... all very realistic & interesting - although it might not be to everyones taste.There are dog...

We stopped here while on our ship's bus/train excursion from and back to Skagway. Such beautiful scenery all around! And we were lucky to have a beautiful sunny day. First, we had lunch at The Hitching Post. It was better than expected.....BBQ chicken, cole slaw, potato, rolls and the best donuts. The staff was friendly and very organized, getting all...

Like so many other reviewers, we stopped here for lunch while on a cruise ship tour from Skagway. Being from Texas, we are a little picky about our BBQ, but the chicken and trimmings were good .... but not particularly special. Plenty filling, however! Also, we had visited the Susan Butcher kennel on the Chena River in Fairbanks but were...

This is a fun place to stop in the Yukon Territory. It's very touristy, but who cares? That's part of the fun. They serve a very good barbecue lunch, and have a gift shop and ice cream parlor. The onsite wildlife museum is very good and has a surprisingly large display of beautiful animals in such a remote location. For...

This is a really fun place to visit. We stopped here for lunch as part of a cruise tour and we were expecting the usual ho-hum food served for large coach parties but the bbq lunch was excellent and the homemade donuts delicious. We had the chance to hold Husky puppies which were adorable and to learn more about the...

We stopped here for lunch with a shore excursion to the Yukon. The chicken dinner was good, but the donuts are the BEST. There are real live animals to see, a small RCMP museum, and a room of taxidermied animals. We got to hold 4-week old puppies and watch the Huskies pull the wheeled carts. The dogs LOVE to work!...

Cruise stop at Skagway - what to do? We rented a car and drove to the Yukon Territory by way of White Pass, the route of the White Pass and Yukon Railroad. We saw the same glorious and unique geography, but had more flexibility to explore. Caribou Crossing Trading Post was a delightful surprise. Just past Carcross on the highway,...

Food and drink were great here so good for a lunch stop but the rest is a bit of a shame. The animals didn't look in the best of condition. The husky dogs were pulling large cars and not sledges. The rest of the animals looked old and tired. The stuffed animal museum was just strange.

This was a fantastic place to stop while touring the Yukon. It's definitely catering to the tourist crowd, so loosen the attachment to reality a little. The puppies were the sweetest, and we were glad for the experience!

We stopped here for lunch with Chilkoot Charters & Tours. I am pretty sure everyone comes here as a tour stop and not a must see destination. Lunch was BBQ chicken, roasted potato, cole slaw, bread, and trays of donuts (the donuts were delicious). They also have Yukon Brewing beer for sale.I didn't do the dog sledding like some...

We stopped here for lunch as part of our tour with Chilkoot Tours. The barbecue chicken lunch was simple but good! Afterwards we spent time playing with the Huskie Puppies and watching them prep a dog sled team for a run. That was amazing. It was so fun to see how excited those dogs got at the prospect of pulling...

This was such an amazing place to stop @ 45 min south of Whitehorse, on our way to Skagway, Alaska. This huge place has THE most impressive wildlife museum collection I have ever seen. From stuffed grizzlies, polar bears, mountain goats, cougars, muskox, bisons, to mammoths, just to name a few! Spent time outdoors also, petting their huskie puppies. (They...

This was part of a tour we did. We got here quite early on and were given a really lovely lunch when we arrived. The dining hall was empty when we got there, and we had BBQ chicken, potatoes, bread, donuts and we really enjoyed it. By the time we finished though, the room was packed. The staff were doing...

Took the 45 minute drive from Whitehorse as a Saturday diversion. The museum was a surprise, with a great collection of stuffed wildlife. The exhibit on the Northwest Mounted Police was also interesting, providing some personal accounts of the early years of law enforcement in Yukon.The petting zoo and husky puppies seemed to be a hit with younger patrons,...

We took a bus/train excursion from Skagway up to Carcross. The drive was beautiful and we learned a lot about the Gold Rush and historical significance of the area. Lunch was bbq chicken and cinnamon mini donuts. Great hot meal on a rainy/cloudy day! We didn't have time to get a ride with the sled dogs, but we visited the...
The food is so so,but the dog sledding is worth it to go. It was nice to go but not necessarily the best use of time considering the price.

We stopped here for a little while with Frontier Excursions & Adventures, and what a nice area. We ate lunch here and got to eat in a covered wagon if desired (for some reason I was the only one in our group who did so, kind of neat). They have a really nice museum showing different animals native to the...

We stopped here as part of a bus/train trip form Skagway to the Yukon. The scenery was incredible both up an down the mountains. The Trading Post was a combination musher camp/ museum/ restaurant. The museum was interesting, there were not only animals, but a RCMP display as well. The sled dogs are really nice, the puppies are great. They...

My boyfriend and I stopped here on our way back from Emerald Lake. The museum was informative, but the live animals were the best, especially the puppy pen! You could interact with them and feed them dog biscuits. Great way to get a feel for the way mushing puppies are raised to be mushing dogs!

We had lunch here which was basci but delicious. They also have sled dogs rides, a Museum which was fantastic and a petting area/zoo where you can meet all the new puppy recruits for sledding. We found the sled dogs to be interesting and to see how excited they get when they know that they are about to take a...

We took a cruise ship excursion from Skagway with the White Pass Yukon Railroad to the US-Canada border, then boarded a bus to Caribou Crossing. Upon arrival, the place looked a little hokey/touristy. Actually, it was pretty touristy, but also pretty cool. We had a nice, although mass prepared, bbq chicken lunch, then wandered the grounds. There is a lot...

Went to Caribou Crossing as part of an excursion on an Alaskan cruise. I wish I could've spent more time there; I loved the museum and all the husky puppies. The food was also very good. Would recommend :)

My husband and I were on a cruise and took the Ultimate Yukon White Pass Excursion. Caribou Crossing was part of the excursion. We enjoyed visiting this quaint little village. The general store was very interesting filled with old time implements and tools. All the shop keepers were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our visit.

Took a cruise to Alaska on the Golden Princess. Wife booked all the excursions I went along for the ride. The Trading Post was part of one of our excursions. It was hoekie but we'll worth it. Matter of fact it was the best of all the other excursions combined.Hot Chicken dinner waiting for us when we arrived and very...
A fabulous place visit and enjoy. We were surprised by the organization. The barbecue was delicious and then the dog sled ride was thrilling. A definate highlight to our visit in the Yukon.

We had lunch here as part of a train/bus excursion from Skagway. The meal of chicken, roast potato and coleslaw was perfect for the location and the weather. We really enjoyed the wildlife museum which was a treasure trove of artifacts and a real education. We were able to get an accurate idea of how huge these animals are. The...
I would recommend a visit here...The staff are friendly, great food and oh... the puppies are so cute. The Wildlife museum is one of the best I have seen. Wonderful gift shop as well.

This area has the most interesting layout, small but mighty, and a desert to boot! Shops have the most unique items I saw in Alaska and the painting of the buildings was a very interesting point of interest.

During a bus tour of this beautiful area, we stopped for lunch at Caribou Crossing. You could have lunch in the big hall, or outside in 'covered wagons' which could seat approx 6 people, great atmosphere. There was a museum to check out, plus the husky sled dogs, which was my favourite. You could also book a dog sled ride...

We enjoyed the excellent hot meal in the large hall... food was surprisingly good, as was the coffee! Fresh made donuts and warm cookies--who can resist that?The taxidermy museum was amazing, and the shop offered items we had not seen in other locations. Dogs & goats were cute. Staff was welcoming.

We thoroughly enjoyed the lunch and museum. We stopped at this location as part of a bus tour from Skagway along the Klondike Highway. I would highly recommend you stopping here to see all the stuffed wild animals, to visit with the dog sledding puppies and to enjoy a simple but good lunch.This is a good stop for all...

This was our bus/rail tour scheduled lunch stop. We had barbequed chicken with some basic sides and a soft roll served cafeteria/buffet style. The eating and serving areas were rustic but clean and designed to accommodate multiple tour groups. It might have been cute to eat outside in one of the covered wagons had the weather been better. I'll admit...

This was one of the highlights of our cruise to Alaska we arrived in Skagway and took a bus to Carcross. Arriving at Carcross Trading Post we had a wonderful bbq chicken lunch followed by an amazing tour of this wonderful place full of farm animals and sled dogs and cute puppies.The taxidermy museum was stunning and i would highly...
We enjoyed everything Caribou Crossing had to offer, especially the museum and husky dogs (both big and small).

This was a stop on our Yukon Expedition and White Pass Scenic Railway excursion arranged through Princess Cruise Line. We immediately went to the "chow line" and were served barbeque chicken, baked potato, homemade rolls and old fashioned fried donuts...YUM. We had our choice of seating inside or out under cover at picnic tables. EVERYTHING was well organized, clean and...

This was an awesome stop where you could get all the things you didn't know you needed but always wanted. There is something for everyone and you don't need to look to far to find unique and amazing original pieces that support the traditional arts.

Cariobou Crossing is solely for tourist, however, they were friendly and fed us well. I really enjoyed the dogsled ride and looking at the animals. Watching and learning about the dogs was really interesting. Many of the dogs seemed to be barking "I want to pull, I'm next, let's go". It was a fun (but short) stop.

I thought the meal was quite good, cornbread was great, cookies were really awesome. Museum was very interesting, displays were awesome. Bison and Mastadon especially. I really enjoyed myself at this place
Had a great time visiting with the sled dogs and panning for gold.The museum animals were interesting.

Over all the whole tour was fantastic, the portion at Cariobou Crossing was really great, the food was very good, the people were out of this world, and musieum was very special to me being a hunter at heart. We didn't have time to see the dogs, but the others on the tour did, and said they were wonderful.
It is a must stop when you're in that area. We had a wonderful time there and wouldn't hesitate again

This stop was an extension of a shore excursion we took while cruising Alaska's Interior Passage. Took the White Pass railroad, then a bus to Caribou Crossing. The barbecue at the crossing was delicious. Grounds are clean. The museum of animals was very interesting. The taxidermy was exceptional and we saw a good display of many wild animals.

Beautiful scenery, Emerald Lake was absolutely breathtaking. Enjoyed visiting with the puppies and other live animals and the RCMP Museum was mostinteresting. The lunch was delicious and the service was very good. The town was quaint and interesting.
Staff let us in for free because it was close to closingKids enjoyed the vast collection of animals10/10 would go there again

I never thought I would have the opportunity to have a Dog Sled ride. This was a huge surprise and an experience I could not pass up. Just awesome! The dogs were just beautiful and their excitement and eagerness to run and pull the sled was infectious.We arrived at Caribou Crossing after a wonderful bus trip from Skagway. Whilst...
Neat place with lots to see. Dogs and pups were so fun. Good museum and nice people. Beautiful area also
Great family fun and great food. All enjoyed from kids to Grandpa. The dog sled was a highlight for Dad and our 7 year old daughter.

The BBQ chicken was served from an outdoor grill but I'm very certain it was cooked inside on the griddle then red BBQ sauce poured on it then taken outside to the grill. Not that much to do there, the pavallian we ate under was somewhat exposed to the outside so it was very cold to us. I could only...
From the dog sledding to the traditional BBQ in a covered wagon, and impressive museum, stunning views, and a gorgeous trip there - simply fantastic. Highly recommend you include this in your trip!

This was an amazing place to visit! I would definitely recommend a family that has teens to do this as my family went and we all had a great time! The food was incredible and it was definitely a memorable day! If you have the chance to I would strongly suggest you to go visit!!!! Thank you to the staff...

We took an excursion while on an Alaskan cruise. We wanted to go to the Yukon. The main stop on this excursion was this trading post. We had a delicious lunch--chicken, baked potatoes, Cole slaw, and fresh, homemade donuts. It was a chilly day so the hot coffee and tea really hit the spot. After lunch we began wandering around...

Our reason for the Yukon tour was the scenery and the puppies. What a treat. They were so cute and running everywhere. If you don't want to get muddy or stinky, this is not for you. It was definitely for me. We gave them treats and pet them and also had a terrific BBQ chicken lunch here. Nice folks all...

We stopped here on our way back from Emerald Lake. We arrived slightly after 10am. We were the only ones there. Around 10:45 am the tour buses showed up. We purchased our dog cart ride in the gift shop. You will receive a sticker for the general attractions and a different color sticker for the cart ride. We had the...
Was coming off a cruise. Worth going there. An out of the way place. The taxidermy museum was very interesting, home to animals you might normally not see. Loved the animals. Meal was very good.
This is a place you must see to believe. The food was great and it transports you to the olden days. The museum is interesting and well worth the time.

Neat little pit stop on our tour of the Yukon. The taxidermy museum is amazing whether you like the art or not. There are so many animals and they are preserved with perfection. The BBQ lunch served was average, the donuts delicious. Cute little gift shop, fake town, and numerous live animals to see. Best part was playing with the...

Good combination of things to do for adults and children. Great museum on stuffed wild animals - mostly northern but some from other parts of world . A RCMP museum. Great place for kids to pet husky pups, goats especially one that jumped fence and played with children, the shetland ponies. If one wanted to experience dog team pulling a...

First of all Hi to Klondike Mike - one of our favourite holiday photos.Our arrival was handled pretty well considering the numbers of people trying to have lunch at the same time. But shortly after we sat down, a large number of others arrived and I'm not sure how they felt - it was busy.The dog pups were...

We visited Caribou Crossing during a stop in Skagway on an Alaskan cruise. We rented a car and arrived before the tour buses. The drive took about 90 minutes including just a few minutes at the border crossing.We had the place almost too ourselves for an hour. We used this time to look around the museum and visit with...

The BBQ chicken oozed blood and the coffee was lukewarm and finally we were offered tiny doughnuts which could well have been fossilized. The small museum of stuffed animals was quite interesting, particularly the giant polar bear, but the conditions in which the sled dogs were kept was not inspiring.

I gave it the one star only because of the horrible condition the sled dogs were kept in and the fact that they had these skinny dogs pulling heavy sleds with heavy people over roads (this was summer, so no snow). The dogs are kept in a rocky area and tied together or else tied to dog houses...very depressing -...

A quite extensive museum of local animals and a woolly mammoth elephant that isn't really ancient, but all the other animals are real and stuffed. There is a section on Canadian Mounties and animals, outside there are a dozen teams of sled dogs. You can take a ride whether it is snow or dry.The puppies are in a separate...
This place has a neat RCMP exhibit at the museum. There's lots of interesting things to see here and great history. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Good stop along the way!

Visiting the puppies and dogs that are in training for the sled races is a great introduction to a sport that is a central part of the northern life. The puppies are very happy to be held and cuddled. The dogs are so excited to be harnessed up for racing that they are leaping over one another.The museum of...
This stop was well worth it! Food was darn good, animals were cool and it was just beautiful! Thank you

There's so much to say about this place. First of all, if you're stopping here for lunch with a tour group, take some time to enjoy your lunch and don't forget to thank the entire dining staff for doing such an excellent job of running the show. Then come the animals. The petting zoo is amazing fun, although beware of...

My daughters had a great time in the animal area where they could pet the animals. There are two smaller type museums. One of which is geared towards the mounties and the other has a large collection of mounted/stuffed animals. Food is available and is great stop along the highway between Skagway and Whitehorse. Worth a stop.

We had terrific time exploring Caribou Crossing on our recent visit to the Yukon. We loved the animals and the ice cream shop, since it was unseasonably warm that day. The young sled dogs pups were adorable! The shop provided a large selection of native and canadian crafts and art, clothes, jewelry and dishes. Our chicken lunch was good, I...

This excursion delivered everything promised. We really enjoyed our dog sled ride with the Iditarod team (even though it's a metal cart with wheels and not a true snow sled) we got to experience the excitement of the dogs pulling us. Then we got to go to the pen where the husky puppies were available for cuddling. The gift shop...

We stopped as part of an excursion with our cruise on the Norwegian Jewel. The restaurant served grilled chicken, rolls, homemade cake donuts, and salad. Food was served on heavy paper plates and balsa wood forks. We thought this was for being eco friendly in avoiding plastic but we did not ask.They had Alaska beers but we did not...

The scenery on the ride to and from Caribou Crossing was amazing. On arrival had a wonderful lunch, had a fun, somewhat bumpy dog sled ride :) and saw adorable animals including some Dr. Seuss alpacas and baby mushing dogs. Would definitely recommend.....!

Just walking through the museum was amazing, but you can play with the husky puppies and donate for treats you can give them, they were all super happy and playful! As well they had an array of animals you could pet and feed as well, if you donate for a paper bag of treat feed they will ALL pile towards...
Gooood location good food nice puppies very good time we had there will definitely try to come back keep it up

Service was excellent, fast , good quality, good quantity -- even seconds! Second time we visited this place and was just a great as the first time. All personnel are very friendly helpful and happy. The venues are very interesting, the dogs and pups delightful. If one is in the area be sure to pay this place a visit

This stop was part of a longer tour by the cruise line that included Carcross (should have spent more time) and the White pass railway. This is where "lunch" was served - chicken leg and something resembling a potato... knife could not cut through it... and coleslaw (that was actually good!) This is a fake Yukon village created for tourists...

We came here in September and had a blast. We took a bus tour from Skagway, tour guide was awesome, he worked as a Ivory carver. They bring us here for lunch and to hang out a couple hours. Worth it!!

Took a day trip into the Yukon and the bus stopped here for lunch! Food was ok, but not great! Doughnuts too! Went into the shop and saw the museum. Went out to see the Ididerad dogs and puppies. That we liked. Didn't take the sled ride, but be aware if you want to you had better sign up for...

Enjoyed the bus driver as he told us facts about the gold rush..he made the trip very pleasant. Enjoyed seeing the Suspension bridge in Canada and the Emerald Lake..Also the BBQ chicken lunch at Caribou Crossing and the museums and the sled dogs and puppies...was a very relaxing excursion that I thoroughly enjoyed....

We stopped here as part of a Princess tour excursion and I'm so glad we did! We were served a delicious BBQ lunch and then had time to visit the attractions they offer: museums, gold panning, petting zoo, gift shop, ice cream shop, and sled dogs. Our favorite was the sled dogs. They had a litter of 4 week old...
This stop was interesting and informative about sledding, animals, and life in Alaska. The scenery on the trip to Caribou Crossing was breath taking with views of black bear and mountain goat.
Good chicken lunch. taxidermy animals was really cool to see and the puppies were adorable. Overall a cool place to visit
It was a great trip. Loved all of it. No tips except best to book online thru your cruise company, as it was jam packed. Tour guild was wonderful.
Nice family atmosphere. Good food and very friendly staff. Taxidermy was fabulous. Dogs were amazing.

To be fair, where ever there are puppies, a good time is to be had!I really enjoyed our drive our to Caribou Crossing. We were greeted with a BBQ lunch of chicken, potato, slaw, and donuts, and were seated in a clean eating area off to the side. After lunch, we enjoyed exploring the property. The petting zoo had...
This was a perfect stop on our cruise. The scenery surrounding was beautiful and getting to see and hold the puppies and other animals was such a treat. I wanted to take one of the baby goats home :)
The tour was awesome, had a great time and enjoyed the amazing views. We would love to go back. The staff are wonderful and attentive. Fantastic!

We stopped here as part of our shore excursion. We ate the bbq chicken dinner with all you can eat donuts for dessert! The food was good and the service even better. They have a small bar for purchasing drinks in the dining room. Out back they have dog 'sleds' for a fee where you can ride on a cart...

Everyone in my family loved this place. And what's not to love? They have do sledding, puppies, a petting zoo, gold panning, and a museum with prehistoric animals. This is a stop with plenty of photo opportunities (including a spot where it looks like you are actually on a climbing expedition.My grandkids loved the puppies of course and at...

We stopped in , on our tour, for lunch, and a look around. WOW. what a neat place. the food was great, the service was good. the museum is awesome. the animals are so interesting. the kids love this place. the gift shop is pretty good too. if you want to take a ride on a dog sled , this...

We a family group of eight including two grandchildren were on a whole day sightseeing tour of the Yukon Territory in Canada. We visited the Caribou Crossing Trading Post - paid a 'family' entrance fee - to see the wildlife museum, which has a very good taxidermy collection and spent some time at the facility for 'Huskies', where the grandkids...

A tour from our cruise took us to Caribou Crossing where we enjoyed a wonderful BBQ chicken lunch, an incredible taxidermy museum of Alaskan and Yukon Territory mounts, watching the mushers and dogs and cuddling the new pups. The bus ride up with stops in Fraser, Emerald Lake and the "desert" were wonderful and the train ride back was well...

I took my 5 year old daughter here and we LOVED it!!!The animal museum was absolutely amazing! So many animals and a great learning experience for kids and adults. A great way to get an up close look at some amazing creatures.Outside they have horses, ponys, goats, alpacas, and chickens. They are so cute! They have bags of...

I thought the sled dogs were cool and of course the puppies and then the museum with all of the animals. The rest of the little touristy village was quite cheesy if you ask me. I would much rather have spent more time in the actual town of Carcross!

Although it was a summerish event, no snow, the experience was amazing! The dogs love what they do and their owner, well she was a wealth of information and passionate about the dogs! Totally enjoyed the ride!

The museum was fascinating. I particularly enjoyed the anecdotes about the characters trying to enter the area during the gold rush".The presenters who introduced us to the dog sled teams and the other farm animals were eloquent, funny and engaging. The food was reasonable(could have been better).The staff were wonderful. The were helpful, well informed and friendly.

Over $200 for a 3 hr bus ride to a roadside stand for a barbecued chicken leg and free coffee (beer and soda cost more) wasn't worth the time or money. Peta would have a fit if they inspected the place. The puppies should be out of reach of visitors. One visitor dropped a pup and it must have been...

Visited Caribou Crossing as part of a full-day excursion from Skagway. Food was good and service was efficient and friendly. Loved the Yukon beer! Lovely gift shop.But the dogs! The cart ride was fun and interesting. I was the only one in our group who opted for the 30-minute version, and had a more in-depth experience. One-on-one attention from...

We enjoyed an excellent bbq chicken dinner, went on an actual dogsled tour through a beautiful wooded area, got to play with a couple of the young husky puppies, and toured the world famous wildlife museum. Overall, me and my husband thoroughly enjoyed our time at Caribou Crossing. There's a whole different feeling just being in the Yukon...we loved it!
What a great place! The staff are wonderful and interactive. Lots to do. The dogs are the star of the shoe here. Playing with the puppies was the kids favorite! It is very clean.
Museum was fascinating. Good food and service. Enjoyed seeing the dogs. Camera a must. It was interesting that you sold ice cream from our home city of London Ontario.

Wow - what else can I say about the Yukon ---the Emerald Lake was just breath taking. Our visit at Caribou Crossing was an adventure with the wildlife - dead and alive. Everyone was so friendly and kind.

We were on a whirlwind cruise-->bus-->train tour and had about an hour and a half at this place. The BBQ meal (almost as good as mom's) was served in hand as soon as you got in line. The RCMP and the taxidermy museum and gift shop were worth the look. After visiting the sled dogs & puppies it was time...

We sailed on the Norweigan Pearl & bought a private tour through a local company in Skaqway. We drove into the Yukon & saw so much beautiful scenery, goats, eagles & bear. We had a fantastic lunch at Caribou Crossing (amazing homemade doughnuts). Toured the museum & even partcipated in dog mushing/sledding. We continued further to view Emerald Lake &...

The scenery was spectacular. The The bus ride and the driver to the crossing were informative, and very cordial. The meal as far as Bar B Que was average, but filling. The museum of animals was ok, however the visit to the dogs was a high light. I now have insight into their training and care. The owners genuinely love...

We visited Caribou Crossing as part of a tour through Chilkoot Charters on a recent cruise to Alaska. We really enjoyed seeing the sled dogs and the puppies were super cute and sweet. My husband enjoyed the taxidermy museum. The food was good and they have the serving line down to an art.

Many have commented about the (very cool!) dog cart opportunity and the chance to play with Alaskan Husky puppies. But if you know anything about mushing, you'll realize this is run by Michelle Phillips and Ed Hopkins (Tagish Lake Kennels) - top dog mushers. This past year - as well as the last 4 or 5 - Michelle raced the...

I very much enjoyed the meal and the hospitality and it was great to see the puppies and other live animals there. A fascinating display of stuffed native animals too, seeing their amazing size. I was a little disappointed with being redirected to various toilets and having difficulty finding where to go. Also the people serving in the souvenir shop...

Beautifull place with a very kindly recepcion in the visitor center, the girls who assist us that day were fantastic, giving attention and all information we needed. For sure we'll return to this place again with our children, but next time we intend to expend some days in this place. Thank you very much!!!
We lived caribou crossing. The sled dogs were fascinating. The taxidermy animals are the most unique collection you will ever see. Make sure you head a few miles further and see emerald lake.
Coming from Australia, it was a real highlight to visit Caribou Crossing, having lunch and just wandering for a few hours was relaxing and to see the sled dogs was a real highlight

What a cool place this was. Really glad we went there. We were travelling with friends and this was the second time they had visited it.We bought some nice gifts for family at the lovely gift store there and were amazed at all the attractions there. Beautiful display of so many different animals including a wooly mammoth. So many things...
Had a fab time, very lovely place and great people. A true reflection of the area and its animals we had a great holiday.
Really enjoyed everything Caribou Crossing had to offer. We just didn't get to stay long enough! Food was delicious.
We were on a bus tour from Skagway port of call for the Coral Princess, visit included a meal and time to enjoy the museum. Absolutely amazing no other words to describe it.
Loved the sled dog interactions and sled rides. Food was good and staff was very friendly. Bring your camera and change to feed the dogs too.

This was part of our rest stop/lunch through our motor coach excursion through Princess excursions. I can see where this would be more interesting to families with small children. There are animals to see such as goats and Husky sled dogs. There is a pricey gift shop, a wildlife gallery of stuffed animals, a cafe and ice cream parlor. Our...

This was my daughter's (age 10) favorite excursion. Our tour drove up from Skagway so we were one of the later groups for the day. We had lunch in a booth that was made from a wagon, we rode in carts pulled by a dogsled team, followed by the best: cuddling with husky puppies. The kids loved the puppies until...

We boarded the train at Skagway, Alaska for a leisurely, but very cold journey up the Yukon gold rush pass - what a magnificent experience it was. The scenery is unbelievable and my SD card filled up very quickly. Caribou Crossing was loads of fun, with a dog sled ride on wheels was loads of fun and laughter and the...

The food was disappointing. We are from Texas, and our idea of BBQ and their idea of BBQ are totally different. It is a cute little set up, and the wildlife exhibits were neat. The conditions for dogs could definitely be better, but I would recommend doing the dog sled here over the Gold Rush dog sled in Juneau. This...
part of a tour stop . we liked it , rustic, nice museum, great chicken lunch and dog cart rides and more. nice gift shop.worth the stop on the tour!

I'm not a tree hugger, hippie or vegan, BUT the conditions that the animals of this establishment are deplorable. PETA obviously does not know about this place. It really was sad to see emaciated dogs, tethered in mosquito infested mud pits of their own feces, with dirty drinking water; goats, lamas, donkeys - all emaciated and forced to stand/lay in...

We enjoyed this stop as a part of our tour into Yukon with Chilkoot Tours. Plenty to see and do. Was disappointed in the dogs though and didn't like that they were all tied up to their individual dog house with no water or food bowls and a plain wooden floor with no straw. The tour includes a BBQ meal...

Part of a very exp excur from Skagway taken by my fiancee and I. Lunch was bbq ckn, cole slaw & fried donuts; good but nothing to write home about. Gift shop & taxidermy museum, while impressive, did not negate the appalling conditions of the petting animals & sled dogs / puppies; mosquito infested mud pits and feces, filthy drinking...
Stopped as part of an organised trip with Chilkoot Charters. Lots to see & do in the middle of the magnificent Yukon.Very well organised lunch, tasty & hot.Would definitely revisit if in the area.

We had a good lunch before walking through the amazing Taxidermy museum, which was a wonderful and surprise! I will try to share some pics. We enjoyed our day at this unexpected stop during our white pass Yukon bus tour off our cruise ship.

This is a must to visit. On your way you cross two borders and a geographical fault line linked with one sided suspension bridge across it. Passing scenery, wild life and blue lakes made us mesmerized. We very well enjoyed the BBQ chicken lunch and can not forget the donuts. Above all the time spent with Husky Puppies was unforgettable....
The museum is fantastic. Loved all the bears and especially the mammoth. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Low price for the entertainment value. Our son loved the dogs.It's a must stop.

This place is a must see if you are touring the area. The food is great, people are fantastic, and history / museum is very entertaining. The greatest part about this stop was the sled dogs. They are a blast to see and really fun to interact with. They have sled rides and info on training the dogs, etc... All...

We stopped late afternoon for a quick visit on our way back to Whitehorse not realizing how extensive the site is and how many different things there are to see and do. After visiting with all the animals outside, and touring the huge, and well stocked, gift shop, we didn't have time for anything else. Next time in the Yukon,...

The history of another era at one place. The animals of the area (now and then ) were display perfect. The Staff was very helpful in all my questions. And the donuts were alsom. Ps grab a few donuts first. They go fast. Can't wait to go back! ?

We had an absolutely amazing time and would love to do this trip again. The bus driver up was incredible and knowledgeable, time was afforded for stops for pictures. Lunch was very good and a wonderful memory for all of our senses! We would love to have been able to buy a black apron from the restaurant and if available...

As a teenage girl traveling with her family, this was my favorite part of our entire trip to Alaska through princess cruises. I really enjoyed the calm, serene aspect of this attraction and the fact that it was an uncrowded facility. We did the sled ride with the dogs which was a lot of fun and I loved playing with...

What an unexpected and amazing surprise.. My brother and I stopped here, he said there used to be a great bakery. Not there anymore, but there are a few buildings made to look like the old days and coffee shop with a wood stove in it. There are young huskys to see and rides with adult dogs too. We strolled...

We had a lot of fun at Caribou Crossing. The BBQ chicken lunch was really good and the homemade doughnuts were the kids favorite! Everyone was so nice and friendly there. They had a few humorous signs around the camp. The wildlife and RCMP museums were interesting and informative, even kept our 12 & 16 year olds entertained. We all...

This was my second visit to Cariboo Crossing; the first was two years ago, also from an Oceania cruise. And the second time was every bit as fun as the first. I was able to introduce a Kiwi to the wonders of sledding; one puppy thought her scarf was the neatest toy ever; the chicken lunch was delicious. All the...
We live nearby and visit Caribou Crossing at least 3 times per year. The staff is always friendly the facility is clean and the petting zoo and puppies are always the highlight.

My husband and I decided to sign up for the "White Pass Rail & Yukon Expedition" this time on our Alaskan cruise through Norwegian Cruise Lines, and we're glad we did. The atmosphere was fun and the food was quite tasty. They had more than enough things to do during our stay, and we particularly enjoyed the Wildlife Museum. It...

We went on a dogsled ride with Michelle & my niece & nephew (and all the adults) had a blast. Michelle gave us great info on the dogs and the race. We'll be cheering for her this year. The little cafe on the property was great for tea and donuts too.

The museum is amazing. The taxidermy that has been done really makes you feel like you've gone back in time with the Wooly Mammoth, Saber Tooth Tigers etc. The BBQ Lunch was really good and the staff were very friendly. Both some nice souveniers in the gift shop and the prices were really reasonable. Had an amazing ice cream cone...

That chicken dinner was a no nonsense belly filling meal. Everything was hot, taste and in a great quantity. Loved the wooden "silverware" and bought some to take back home and share with friends. Personally, I could of eaten 8-10 of those fantastic doughnuts. The entire staff was so helpful and friendly, and VERY knowledgeable. Just seeing they mu7seum was...

We stopped here on a short trip up to the Yukon on our stop in Skagway, AK. The town of Carcross and the Caribou Crossing stop is situated in perhaps one of the most beautiful valleys I've seen so far. I would love to come back in the winter sometime, regardless of the extreme cold I'm sure they recieve. The...

Our bus tour pulled up at Caribou Crossing for lunch. I was expecting a small greasy spoon in the middle of no where. WELL! Was I surprised! This was a restaurant , museum , gift shop, mini petting zoo(with some very clever goats might I add) and dog sled rides! The amazing friendly staff was so welcoming. The BBQ'd meal...
We had a good lunch. the kids rode the dogsled, they loved the puppies! Had a little museum stuffed wildlife, A fun visit.

Working up in Whitehorse for 2 weeks I was told to go to Carcross/Skagway. I headed out early in the morning and this was my first stop. I was the only one there. I went into the gift shop and a really nice girl named Sara greeted me and struck up a conversation. She gave me the locals rate and...

We stopped here as part of our "White Pass Rail & Yukon Expedition" shore excursion w/ Holland America. The food was very good...BBQ chicken, coleslaw, home made donuts and drinks for purchase. You could eat indoors or outside in a covered wagon converted to tables. After lunch you can explore this little "town" and visit the Wildlife Museum, Dog Mushers...

My friend and I visited at the end of August 2014. Really enjoyed all the animals. The dogs were amazing, loved the pigs, donkeys, goats, etc. The museum park was interesting. Would recommend for families or animal lovers.

I cannot say enough about how much we enjoyed this experience.The staff was so friendly the facilities were clean. The dogs were amazing. My 18-year-old daughter and I did this trip together and we both agreed this was the favorite part of our Alaskan cruise. Don't miss this you will regret it.

We took a trip, through Chilkoot, from a cruise ship berthed in Skagway, on the White Pass Railroad. The rail trip was full of fantastic scenery. On reaching the summit we transferred to a coach for a road trip. We saw the Carcross Desert and the Emerald Lake but one of the real highlights was a stop at Caribou Crossing...

We came on a stop to carcross on our way to Whitehorse. We came and it was a nice little area. The lunch was really good and the mini donuts were amazing. Then we went to see the husky puppies. One mother let us see and hold her puppies. They were ten days old. They were so cute. Then after...

Came here as part of a tour organised by Chilkoot. First we had lunch which I enjoyed Chicken, baked potato and coleslaw, bread rolls and donuts. My daughter thoroughly enjoyed the farm animals and fed the goats. She also went on a sled ride. Although we paid for 15 mins she was back by 10mins and she said that included...

This was part of our tour with Chilkoot Tours, including lunch and a chance to interact with the sled dogs and pups, there was a museum, and petting zoo and you could also buy ice cream. Lunch was okay, served up as you entered, and then there was a general seating area, or you could sit in a covered wagon....

If you need a place to stop I guess stop. I came here as part of a train trip tour from Skagway. If you have kids or really like dogs, I guess it's okay. I was just getting really tired of being stuck in tourist traps. The ice cream was the best part of this stop.

We (4 Aussies) had a break in Carcross/Caribou Crossing during a day trip from Skagway with Beyond Skagway personalised tours - for us the highlight of the village was the wonderful coffee and freshly made HUGE sandwiches at Caribou Crossing cafe (and very friendly service). The coffee was definitely the best we had since leaving Australia. If you are passing...

When we first pulled up I had to roll my eyes at the faux historic village set up. However, I enjoyed the visit. I took a dog sled ride which was a fun new experience. The dogs clearly enjoyed the trip as well. I can understand why others are shocked by the dogs' condition, but I did not share that...

What a great stop! Enjoy the bbq chicken lunch followed by rolo ice cream! Food is quite good and coffee/tea included. Don't miss out on the dog sled ride and the museum. Some o the husky puppies are there or all to pet as well a other small animals. A great day trip/stop while in the Yukon.

Visited yesterday with daughter and grand-daughter (5) - Big Fun! Enjoyed the Mountie Museum and the Wildlife Museum - some pretty amazing Beringia mammals there too! And of course the live animals were great, especially the 4-week-old puppies that Laura got to hold (carefully) on her lap. Yummy café...overall, great value and definitely worth repeat visits!

The coach parties may put you off if you are an independent traveller but this is a real little gem of a community. It is worth going into the Visitor Centre and picking up a Heritage Trail. Walk around the back streets and see all the old cabins. Some are really quirky and show the Yukon sense of humour. Go...

If you have travelled this far a visit to the Caribou trading post Museum, sled dog rides & petting zoo is a must. An excellent chicken BBQ lunch followed by a visit to the wildlife museum.The taxidermy museum is extraordinary with exhibits like the largest polar bear ever recorded, grizzly bear, brown bear, unreal huge bison,wolves,lynx ,replica wolly mammoth &...

On a cold rainy June 2014 day we stopped here for a visit to the town. There are a couple of stores, restaurants, a post office, and nice Visitor Center. Don't miss the Real Sourdough Bread place ( I believe called Gold Miners) where they serve wonderful soups, sandwiches, and awesome sourdough rolls and bread of all kinds-like cinnamon rolls,...

Drove here from Skagway and after stopping at Carcross which is a cute town with many wonderful First Nations people. Saw many Caribou around and the carcross dessert. There are goats, a wonderful wildlife museum and sled dogs. The gift shop here is excellent and so is the bbq chicken lunch. I highly recommend a stop but there are lots...
Sled dogs, taxidermy museum, gift shop and BBQ. A great little stop for lunch. The ice cream shop only takes cash so I had to wait until the next stop in Carcross :(

We took a tour to the Yukon by bus and stopped here for lunch. The chicken was ok but my favorite thing was those doughnuts, yum yum. My sister spotted a helicopter on the ground so we signed up for a 15 minute ride. It was wonderful going up above those snow covered mtns. I missed seeing the sled dog...

Our boys are 16 and 10 and enjoyed the stop here. Huge stuffed animal collection. Had 2 3 week old pups that the boys could snuggle and it was neat to see the sled dogs on the camp environment. The boys also got to pan for gold. We did the BBQ lunch which was ok and there were sandwiches available...

Stopped by for the bbq lunch and property tour while on a cruise tour. Interesting all around but what made it all the more interesting was what we found out from our tour guide. The way this tour got started was quite a nice story. About 20 years ago, a Holland America ship was driving up into Carcross and actually...

We visited Caribou Crossing as part of our Cruise Excursion in early May. As soon as we arrived we served BBQ chicken lunch with all you can eat donuts for dessert. Our favorite part of our visit here was our time with the sled dogs. A new liter of puppies was due any day but, we were too early. They...

During our Princess cruise we booked an excursion with a bus ride up to Carcross and the train ride back. The views from the bus ride were great and I would take this tour again. My only disappointment was that we had 1.5 hours at this built for tourists town and only 20 minutes at the real town where I...

Would highly recommend a visit to Caribou Crossing. We were on an Alaskan Cruise and rented a car to drive to Carcross and meet the husky dogs. My children and ourselves absolutely loved it. My daughter said it was the best day of her life!!
We booked as an excursion through our cruise line. Aside from the rainy day, it was an enjoyable visit. The BBQ lunch was good and we especially enjoyed the 7 week old Alaskan Husky puppies!

In Caribou Crossing I loved the 15 minute helicopter ride over the surrounding Southern Lakes region .It was amazing! i saw the mountains and Lakes,the autunmal colours of the trees,the desert Carcross,BEAUTIFUL !!!

We visited this place as an optional tour during our cruise to Alaska.We love the place, specially the Wildlife Museum and its great white bear (awesome!). The food was good. the chicken very tasty as well as the slaw. The facilities were clean and well kept. Definitely a place to visit again and to recommend to friends.

I grew up near Carcross and often drove by the site which has become Caribou Crossing. We had my mom and two kids with us and we had to come back out and insist that she come in to join us, we were so impressed by the gallery of stuffed animals. We were there on an off-season day so it...
We wished we had more time to spend here. But with the time we did have, it was great. Everyone here was very pleasant to talk to and visit with.

A cute place with a couple photo ops and quaint surrounding if you're on your way to catch a train and you're into the history of the Yukon. Not much to hold your interest otherwise and I would not recommend you visit here unless you're on your way to something else to see or do.

We stopped here as port of our Yukon expedition from our cruise so there was no cost. They provided lunch as part of the cruise. Pretty good chicken and slaw. Rest rooms were very clean. There were wooden walkways between the buildings so wheelchairs would be OK. One building had stairs though.After we dined, we explored. It's a fascinating...

The Husky puppies were cute. All the dogs were friendly. The museum was interesting and the displays were well done. Well worth the money and time.The food was what we were looking for after 3 days on a cruise ship. The home made doughnuts were great.The facilities were clean and well kept. It is a family run attraction with...

Our tour group stopped at Caribou Crossing in the Yukon for a short visit. They served us a western style lunch with bb chicken, cole slaw, rolls and freshly baked doughnuts. The attraction is a series of faux western buildings with a gift shop and ice cream parlor tucked behind the facades. There is a small exhibit of animals, a...

We stopped here as part of a Chilkoot 7-hr. tour. It sounds like a long day, but there is so much to see that we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Our day started with a relaxing 2 1/2 hr. train ride from Skagway. We were in the last train car, and my hubby was thrilled to have the opportunity stand on...

We stopped here has part of a tour off Princess Cruises and we had a blast. The BBQ lunch was great with huge portions and all of the fresh and warm home made doughnuts you could eat. After lunch we treated ourselves to great ice cream at a bakery and snack shop a few steps away. They had a great...

We booked on Frontier excursions ..the tour was everything and more ...after many stops along the way..We reached Caribou Crossing .At the Caribou Cafe we.had a delicious BBq lunch ,and all the warm homemade donuts you could eat...After lunch there were many places to visit. .the Wildlife Museum have a display of Artic animals.(That still looked alive). There are dog...

The staff were very friendly and informative upon walking in the door. The place is like stepping back 40 years in time when things were not quite so refined. The taxidermy was quite impressive and of very good quality. It was top notch. We did not ride the dog sled as we had already done so previously. However we watched...

We made a short stop here and we were lucky that it wasn't busy when we arrived but just as we were leaving a huge group of buses pulled up and I would imagine that it wouldn't be nearly as fun with those huge crowds. We enjoyed looking around in the wildlife museum and it was fun to play with...

We visited Caribou Crossing as part of a stop on the Deluxe Yukon Exercusion we booked directly through Frontier Excursions during our cruise stop in Skagway. Included was our lunch, the museum including a phenomemal exhibit of large (bears, moose, etc) stuffed animals, petting zoo with baby goats and a 2 week old donkey. We also saw the sled dogs...

We were brought here as part of a tour from our cruise to Skagway, Alaska on board the Norwegian Sun. They gave us a barbecue chicken lunch with 1/4 chicken, coleslaw, 1/2 baked potato and doughnuts. Great and generous lunch! There is also a gift shop, very interesting stuffed animal museum, ice cream parlor and dog-sled area. The dog-sled area...

We stopped on a day without many visitors and immediately went on a husky dog cart ride. We just did the 15 min ride, but it was a nice experience and we enjoyed what we learned from our driver. Next we did some panning for gold, another good experience. Every bag has real Yukon gold, and it took longer than...

We visited this typical tourist trap as part of a shore excursion off the Sapphire Princess in May, 2013. The whole experience (except the ride on the White Pass Railroad) was a disaster. The touring company sent us out in a snow squall in a bus with no heat ... and the destination was this awful place deep in the...

We visited Caribou Crossing as part of the Whitepass Railway and Yukon Expedition tour out of Skagway. What a disappointment this venue was. Caribou Crossing is a make belief reconstruction of a pioneer trading post from the gold rush era, consisting of fake façades. The price of the whole tour included a BBQ lunch, which consisted of chicken, a minute...

This was part of the cruise ship excursion with the combined white pass railway and motor coach tour. Lunch was barbecued chicken, cole slaw, baked potato, roll, and homemade donuts. Lunch was very good and included in our tour cost. The other attractions were included in our tour cost. I would not have paid extra for them. The taxidermy museum...

Caribou Crossing was well worth the modest price of admission! The wildlife museum was well done. The sled dogs were also very cool; my wife and I really enjoyed being able to play with the husky puppies and their mothers. Great gift shop, as well!

I have to agree with the last reviewer who wrote to stay away if you love dogs. I have nothing against dog sledding either. Some of the dogs looked fine, very lean but obviously fit. But we saw a Mama dog with her puppies that looked to be close to starvation. Ribs and bones sticking out all over. Either the...

My family and I were on a shore excursion from Skagway when we visited Michelle Phillips and others at Caribou Crossing. By far our favorite part was visiting with the dogs! We loved meeting Michelle, meeting Geisha who we had seen on TV, playing with the puppies - what a fabulous experience.The food was good, the wildlife museum was...

We arrived and ate a delicious bar-b-que chicken lunch. I wanted to ride a dog sled, so after lunch we hurried over to get in line for that. I got to get on a sled in about 10 minutes. The sled ride was fun and worth the money for a unique chance to ride behind a team we may see...

This visit was part of a broader Princess Cruises excursion. We had a BBQ lunch here which was average - the BBQ meat was nice but the rest of the meal was fairly average. The price being paid for the excursions suggest that a better quality meal is in order. Everything else appeared rather cheesy/US-tourist centric, so after finding little...

As others have said, a GREAT place to visit. There are new owners this summer (2012) & they do a fabulous job. The sled dog ride is fabulous - one of the best things we did on our trip to Alaska & Canada! By taking the ride, you actually are helping train the dogs. It's so clear that the owners...

My friends actually live down the street from here, but they had never been - so when I came to visit we decided to check it out.Wow!We had so much fun!! There's a neat museum with information and taxidermied animals from around the Yukon...LIFE SIZED so some of them are a little scary!!Exit the museum and you're...

What a great place! We knew it would be touristy, but we were so pleasantly surprised when the place had lots of character too! The BBQ was good and the seating in covered wagons really fun. The dog sled ride was fun, but even better was playing with the puppies.Our 6 year-old loved it, so did Mom & Dad!

It was great to see this working dog facility not far from Whitehorse. I was concerned about one of the reviews I read earlier on TripAdvisor called “If you love dogs - STAY AWAY”. I saw none of the concerns on my visit just six weeks after that review.The here dogs are not pets. They are working dogs that...

We were doing a short road trip from Skagway up to Emerald Lake, and stopped here to check the place out and to have lunch. The lunch was average and a bit on the pricey side ($15.50CAD for a thigh/leg, cole slaw, potato and bread) - but there's not much else there in terms of restaurants. Some of our party...

We thoroughly enjoyed this attraction. The meal that was served was very tasty and the service was organized and quick considering the number of people who needed to be fed. For dessert, all you can eat homemade sugared cinnamon doughnuts - YUM! These were like the ones my grand mother used to make - very good! And I don't usually...

We went here on a tour of Yukon with Trail of 98 Tours.Cariboo Crossing was a lot of fun, tasty lunch, especially the cinnamon donuts.The wildlife museum was suprisingly interesting.I loved the "petting zoo", cute little baby goat, minature horses and more.Best of all were the sled pups...pet them, hold them..and (for a fee) a...

Most of this attraction is kind of cheesy, but ok for the experience. It was the condition of the dogs there that ruined the experience for my family.Let me start by saying I am not against dog sledding. In fact, the day before we did a dog-sled excursion where we flew to a glacier and rode on a dog...

The dogs were the highlight of our visit. There were puppies too! The dos want to work... They go crazy barking when another team pulls in. They want to join them!The chicken meal was quite good, donuts were great! Former owners were taxidermists and their work is on display. Nice to see the local wildlife up close.Worth a...

We took a Disney Cruise up to Skagway and then joined the Chilkoot Tour up to Caribou Crossing. There we had an amazing time! First we rode the dog sled ride- which is seperate from the caribou crossing but still in the same area. Then Drew from Caribou Crossing took an old time portrait of us and emailed us the...

I used to live in Whitehorse and would make the drive on a Sunday just to visit. Lots to see, friendly staff. Love to see the dogs and cuddle with the puppies. The museum is nicely laid out with good descriptions of the wildlife. This attraction is well worth the visit.

A well done, tasteful display of the full variety of Yukon wildlife both past and present. We live only an hour away and visit at least once a year. Tasty yet healthy food freshly made with fresh ingredients.
